name: AS_2_4_Manage_Patient_Bed_Assignment
title: AS.2.4 Manage Patient Bed Assignment (Function)
description: Support interactions with other systems, applications, and modules to ensure that the patient's bed assignments within the facility optimize care and minimize risks e.g., of exposure to contagious patients.
purpose: Access to a list of available beds is important to safely manage the care of patients whose bed requirements may change based on change in condition or risk factors. For example, a patient may need a room with special equipment or to be close to the nursing station or to be in a private room.

statement.label: AS.2.4#01
statement.requirement: The system SHOULD provide the ability to manage patient bed assignment interactions that are internal or external to the system (e.g., including temporary bed assignments).

statement.label: AS.2.4#02
statement.requirement: The system MAY transmit patient information to an external system that will facilitate bed assignment, care optimization and risk mitigation.

statement.label: AS.2.4#03
statement.requirement: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render lists of information to help enable effective bed assignment, including at a minimum, list of patients currently within the facility, a list of empty rooms and a list of available patient care spaces.

statement.label: AS.2.4#04
statement.requirement: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render lists of information on patient status to help enable effective bed assignment, including at a minimum, a list of patients waiting to be triaged, a list of patients waiting to be registered, and a list of patients that have been admitted to the facility but are queued up for a transition of care.

statement.label: AS.2.4#05
statement.requirement: The system MAY provide the ability to render waiting time for patients not yet brought to a treatment area.

statement.label: AS.2.4#06
statement.requirement: The system MAY provide the ability to render the number of patients that have been admitted to the facility but are queued up for a transition of care.

statement.label: AS.2.4#07
statement.requirement: The system MAY provide the ability to render information on incoming transported patients (e.g., rescue in-bounds).

statement.label: AS.2.4#08
statement.requirement: The system MAY provide the ability to manage re-location of patients.

statement.label: AS.2.4#09
statement.requirement: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage separately multiple patients being simultaneously cared for in a single room or in an identified space according to scope of practice, organizational policy, and/or jurisdictional law.

statement.label: AS.2.4#10
statement.requirement: The system MAY provide the ability to manage temporary beds and the patients in the temporary beds according to scope of practice, organizational policy, and/or jurisdictional law.

statement.label: AS.2.4#11
statement.requirement: The system MAY tag with a status indication that the patient is ready for a transition of care (e.g., transport to an inpatient bed).
